Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate different types of habitats, such as land habitats (playground, garden, forest) and water habitats (pond, stream, lake).
The student can draw a variety of living things commonly found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, lizards, squirrels, fish, or clams.
The student can show visual comparisons of the types of living things in different habitats by including varied organisms in their drawing.
The student can arrange living things in their drawings to highlight patterns of biodiversity in different habitats.
The student can label the different plants and animals in their drawing to clearly identify them.
The student can organize their drawing to reflect how observations help identify patterns in plant and animal diversity across habitats.
